page.title: 20THURLASTON FETE
page.content:
Summer time comes around again! Saturday 22nd June we hear in the Advertiser "was the day of the Thurlaston village fete...Joan Sullivan opened the fete in a pleasing manner". Attention centred on the village hall to which half the proceeds went. The other half went to the church. There was a raffle and many other side shows including darts and skittles. The fete raised 415 pounds. "Tea served in the village hall with home-made cakes,was deservedly popular. The brave enjoyed ice cream and sqash..." Altogether "an essentially English afternoon once again stressed the values of life in a Warwickshire village."
GOODBYE FROM 2E AND EVERYONE AT DUNSMORE GIRLS SCHOOL!
